com.checkout.httpconnector

Class HttpConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.checkout.httpconnector.HttpConnector

  • public class HttpConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to manage the http connections with Checkout's server. Serves as an abstraction for get and post requests Created by manonh on 07/08/2015.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Enumeration representing the different types of HTTP methods that can be used

      • postRequest

        public <T> Response<T> postRequest(java.lang.String url,
                          java.lang.String key,
                          java.lang.String payload,
                          java.lang.Class<T> returnType)
                        throws com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Method allowing to send a POST request to a given url with a payload
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        url - : String containing the url the request must be sent to
        key - : String containing the public key of the merchant
        payload - : String containing the data to be sent with the request
        returnType - : T instance returned by the server
        Returns:
        : Response, Response object containing a T instance corresponding to the server's response
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - : If there is a problem with the communication with the server
        com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException - : If the JSON is not correct, it cannot be parsed

        Throws:

        com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException - : If the JSON is not correct, it cannot be parsed
